title: Failed container 'unable to mount a file' error when running Quarkus local build Vale linter (DVale) on RHEL
body:
### Describe the bug

Problem: 

Container error occurs on RHEL OS when running any of the following Vale commands locally in the Quarkus git repo:

````
./mvnw -f docs test -Dvale -DvaleLevel=suggestion 
./mvnw -f docs test -Dvale=git -DvaleLevel=warning
./mvnw -f docs test -Dvale='doc-.*' -DvaleLevel=error 
````


2022-11-07 18:45:57,445 ERROR [üê≥ .io/.15.5]] (main) Log output from the failed container:

````
2022-11-07 18:45:56,654 WARN  [üê≥ .io/.15.5]] (main) Unable to mount a file from test host into a running container. This may be a misconfiguration or limitation of your Docker environment. Some features might not work.
2022-11-07 18:45:56,681 INFO  [üê≥ .io/.15.5]] (main) Container docker.io/jdkato/vale:v2.15.5 is starting: d6305b094543c47cc91cb18994a10f93da493e6db208abf3f308a0520a5c8df4
2022-11-07 18:45:57,351 ERROR [üê≥ .io/.15.5]] (main) Could not start container: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Container did not start correctly.

....

{
  "Code": "E100",
  "Text": "E100 [--config] Runtime error\n\npath '/vale/vale.ini' does not exist\n\nExecution stopped with code 1."
}

````

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92924207/200391389-0aba6237-3f22-466a-af70-a85412ae52ca.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92924207/200391226-9cb44f7d-71fb-4bbb-81ac-9d4ea5dbeb43.png)



### Expected behavior

The Vale linter runs and checks Quarkus doc (asciidoc) content for Quarkus style rules as configured in the .vale.ini

### Actual behavior


2022-11-07 18:45:57,445 ERROR [üê≥ .io/.15.5]] (main) Log output from the failed container:

````
2022-11-07 18:45:56,654 WARN  [üê≥ .io/.15.5]] (main) Unable to mount a file from test host into a running container. This may be a misconfiguration or limitation of your Docker environment. Some features might not work.
2022-11-07 18:45:56,681 INFO  [üê≥ .io/.15.5]] (main) Container docker.io/jdkato/vale:v2.15.5 is starting: d6305b094543c47cc91cb18994a10f93da493e6db208abf3f308a0520a5c8df4
2022-11-07 18:45:57,351 ERROR [üê≥ .io/.15.5]] (main) Could not start container: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Container did not start correctly.

....

{
  "Code": "E100",
  "Text": "E100 [--config] Runtime error\n\npath '/vale/vale.ini' does not exist\n\nExecution stopped with code 1."
}

````

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92924207/200391389-0aba6237-3f22-466a-af70-a85412ae52ca.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/92924207/200391226-9cb44f7d-71fb-4bbb-81ac-9d4ea5dbeb43.png)



### How to Reproduce?
